intro: Stachys germanica var. reinertii, commonly known as the German hedge nettle, is a perennial herb native to Europe. It features square, hairy stems and opposite, heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture. The plant produces small, pale purple to white flowers in whorled clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodlands or along stream banks. Its leaves are sometimes used in traditional herbal remedies for their mild sedative properties.
